name: JIRA Cleanup
description: Issues closed during an effort to tidy up JIRA
releaseNotes: Release Notes - Qpid - Version JIRA Cleanup

issues.title: [Java Client] - Tidy up tasks from QPID-1289
Unable to perform Java 0-10 InVM testing
Add XML configuration syntax for ACLs in Java broker
Transactions not atomic in the face of fail over
Acks during failover
Potential deadlocks during failover
Connection closure during Initial Connection will hang client
AMQProtocolSession allows getChannel to return null
Propogated timeout on connection close does not reduce between session close.
Client closeure can be processed before final message ack.
Client contains lots of distinct timeouts these need to be consolidated and exposed to client applications
Client Code doesn't correctly close a JMSSession/Channel when the broker demands it.
Redelivered information is currently recorded per message it should be per message per queue.
HeadersExchange doesnot correctly implement isBound
Using a private queue with selector will result in non matching messages being left on the broker queue as they will not be consumed.
AMQConnection.start() is not threadsafe
the java client unnecessarily rejects messages prior to rollback, and the java broker appears to depend on this behavior
AMQChannel.queueDeletion causes unacked msgs to be discarded.
MessageRequeueTest.testTwoCompetingConsumers occasionally fails
Client protocol state is maintiained between connections when the connection fails during initial connection
SysTests - AckTest doesn't test for persistent messaging.
A message be acknowledged after its message consumer is closed but don't think we allow that.
